title: Shakespeare's King Henry V | Henry's Speech to his Troops before Invading Harfluer
description:
A section of Shakespeare's Henry V which I memorized. This is Act III, Scene 1, Lines 1-34.  

Credits to Ella Fullante for recording the video. 

Note: in those lines above mentioned, I forgot several words in the recitation. Therefore, this is not a correct and is an incomplete recalling of those lines. 

Make sure to like and subscribe!

Check out my podcast: Fining Ideas | The Colton Kirby Show: https://anchor.fm/coltonkirby

transcript_parts.text: recitation is from act three scene one
and henry is going to invade the first
town that he's going to invade in france
king henry
and he is rallying his troops and
telling them or encouraging them about
how they're going to
take the town so i am henry and that is
the only character
and you are the troops so you guys can
be a part of it
once more unto the breach dear friends
once more
or close the wall up with our english
dead in peace there's nothing so becomes
a man as modest stillness and humility
but when the blast of war blows in our
ears then imitate the action of the
tiger
stiffness in you summon up the blood the
skies fair nature with hard favored rage
and lend the eye terrible aspect as
fearfully as delta gold rock
overhang and judges confounded base
swirled with the wild and wasteful ocean
now set the teeth
and stretch the nostril wide hold hard
the breath
and bend up every spirit to its full
height on
on your nobles english whose blood was
fed from fathers of war proof
fathers that like so many alexanders
having these parts from more until even
fought
and cheated their swords for lack of
argument dishonor not your mothers
now test that those whom you call your
fathers to beget you
they copy now to men of grosser blood
and teach them how to war
and you good yeoman whose limbs were
made in england
let us swear that you are worth your
breeding which i doubt not
and there are none of you that i see so
mean in base
that have not noble luster in your eyes
i see you stand like greyhounds in the
slips
straining upon the straight the game's
the foot follow your spirits
upon this charge cry god for harry
england
and saint george
